text: Bill Of Rights
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: In addition to, and amendment of, the Constitution of the United States
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: of America, proposed by Congress and ratified by the Legislatures of
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: the several States, pursuant to the Fifth Article of the original
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Constitution
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Article I
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Congress shall make no law respecting an establishment of religion,
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: or prohibiting the free exercise thereof; or abridging the freedom
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: of speech, or of the press; or the right of the people peaceably to
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: assemble, and to petition the Government for a redress of grievances.
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Article II
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: A well regulated Militia being necessary to the security of a free
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: State, the right of the people to keep and bear Arms shall not be
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: infringed.
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Article III
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: No Soldier shall in time of peace be quartered in any house without
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: the consent of the Owner, nor in time of war, but in a manner to be
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: prescribed by law.
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Article IV
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: The right of the people to be secure in their persons, houses, papers,
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: and effects, against unreasonable searches and seizures, shall not
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: be violated, and no warrants shall issue, but upon probable cause,
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: supported by Oath or Affirmation, and particularly describing the place
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: to be searched, and the persons or things to be seized.
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Article V
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: No person shall be held to answer for a capital, or otherwise infamous
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: crime, unless on a presentment or indictment of a Grand Jury, except in
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: cases arising in the land or naval forces, or in the Militia, when in
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: actual service in time of War or public danger; nor shall any person
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: be subject for the same offence to be twice put in jeopardy of life
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: or limb; nor shall be compelled in any Criminal Case to be a witness
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: against himself, nor be deprived of life, liberty, or property, without
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: due process of law; nor shall private property be taken for public use,
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: without just compensation.
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Article VI
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: In all criminal prosecutions, the accused shall enjoy the right to a
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: speedy and public trial, by an impartial jury of the State and district
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: wherein the crime shall have been committed, which district shall have
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: been previously ascertained by law, and to be informed of the nature
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: and cause of the accusation; to be confronted with the witnesses against
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: him; to have compulsory process for obtaining witnesses in his favour,
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: and to have the Assistance of Counsel for his defence.
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Article VII
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: In suits at common law, where the value in controversy shall exceed
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: twenty dollars, the right of trial by jury shall be preserved, and no
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: fact tried by a jury shall be otherwise re-examined in any Court of the
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: United States, than according to the rules of the common law.
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Article VIII
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Excessive bail shall not be required, nor excessive fines imposed, nor
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: cruel and unusual punishments inflicted.
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Article IX
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: The enumeration in the Constitution, of certain rights, shall not be
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: construed to deny or disparage others retained by the people.
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Article X
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: The powers not delegated to the United States by the Constitution, nor
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: prohibited by it to the States, are reserved to the States respectively,
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: or to the people.
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Article XI
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: The Judicial power of the United States shall not be construed to extend
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: to any suit in law or equity, commenced or prosecuted against one of the
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: United States by Citizens of another State, or by Citizens or Subjects
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: of any Foreign State.
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Article XII
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: The electors shall meet in their respective States, and vote by ballot
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: for President and Vice-President, one of whom, at least, shall not be an
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: inhabitant of the same State with themselves; they shall name in their
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: ballots the person voted for as President; and in distinct ballots the
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: person voted for as Vice-President; and they shall make distinct lists
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: of all persons voted for as President, and of all persons voted for as
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Vice President, and of the number of votes for each, which lists
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: they shall sign and certify, and transmit sealed to the seat of the
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: government of the United States, directed to the President of the
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Senate;--The President of the Senate shall, in the presence of the
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Senate and House of Representatives, open all the certificates and the
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: votes shall then be counted;--The person having the greatest number
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: of votes for President, shall be the President, if such number be a
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: majority of the whole number of Electors appointed; and if no person
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: have such majority, then from the persons having the highest numbers not
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: exceeding three on the list of those voted for as President, the House of
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Representatives shall choose immediately, by ballot, the President.
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: But in choosing the President, the votes shall be taken by States,
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: the representation from each State having one vote; a quorum for this
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: purpose shall consist of a member or members from two-thirds of the
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: States, and a majority of all the States shall be necessary to a
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: choice. And if the House of Representatives shall not choose a President
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: whenever the right of choice shall devolve upon them, before the fourth
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: day of March next following, then the Vice-President shall act
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: as President, as in the case of the death or other constitutional
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: disability of the President. The person having the greatest number of
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: votes as Vice-President, shall be the Vice-President, if such a number
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: be a majority of the whole number of Electors appointed, and if no
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: person have a majority, then from the two highest numbers on the list,
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: the Senate shall choose the Vice-President; a quorum for the purpose
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: shall consist of two-thirds of the whole number of Senators, and a
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: majority of the whole number shall be necessary to a choice. But no
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: person constitutionally ineligible to the office of President shall be
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: eligible to that of Vice-President of the United States.
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Article XIII
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Section 1. Neither slavery nor involuntary servitude, except as a
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: punishment for crime whereof the party shall have been duly convicted,
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: shall exist within the United States, or any place subject to their
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: jurisdiction.
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Section 2. Congress shall have power to enforce this article by
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: appropriate legislation.
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Article XIV
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Section 1. All persons born or naturalized in the United States, and
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: subject to the jurisdiction thereof, are citizens of the United States
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: and of the State wherein they reside. No State shall make or enforce any
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: law which shall abridge the privileges or immunities of citizens of the
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: United States; nor shall any State deprive any person of life, liberty,
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: or property, without due process of law; nor deny to any person within
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: its jurisdiction the equal protection of the laws.
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Section 2. Representatives shall be apportioned among the several States
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: according to their respective numbers, counting the whole number of
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: persons in each State, excluding Indians not taxed. But when the right
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: to vote at any election for the choice of electors for President and
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Vice-President of the United States, Representatives in Congress,
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: the Executive and Judicial officers of a State, or the members of the
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Legislature thereof, is denied to any of the male inhabitants of such
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: State, being twenty-one years of age, and citizens of the United States,
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: or in any way abridged, except for participation in rebellion, or other
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: crime, the basis of representation therein shall be reduced in the
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: proportion which the number of such male citizens shall bear to the
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: whole number of male citizens twenty-one years of age in such State.
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Section 3. No person shall be a Senator or Representative in Congress,
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: or elector of President and Vice-President, or hold any office, civil
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: or military, under the United States, or under any State, who, having
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: previously taken an oath, as a member of Congress, or as an officer of
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: the United States, or as a member of any State legislature, or as an
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: executive or judicial officer of any State, to support the Constitution
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: of the United States, shall have engaged in insurrection or rebellion
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: against the same, or given aid or comfort to the enemies thereof.
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: But Congress may by a vote of two-thirds of each House, remove such
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: disability.
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Section 4. The validity of the public debt of the United States,
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: authorized by law, including debts incurred for payment of pensions and
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: bounties for services in suppressing insurrection or rebellion, shall
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: not be questioned. But neither the United States nor any State shall
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: assume or pay any debt or obligation incurred in aid of insurrection
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: or rebellion against the United States, or any claim for the loss or
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: emancipation of any slave; but all such debts, obligations and claims
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: shall be held illegal and void.
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Section 5. The Congress shall have power to enforce, by appropriate
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: legislation, the provisions of this article.
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Article XV
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Section 1. The right of citizens of the United States to vote shall not
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: be denied or abridged by the United States or by any State on account of
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: race, colour, or previous condition of servitude.
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: Section 2. The Congress shall have power to enforce this article by
author: Tocqueville, Alexis de

text: appropriate legislation.
